item.title: Deploy your first App
item.description:
Requirements

  • You have a running Root Orchestrator with at least one Cluster Orchestrator registered.
  • You have at least one Worker Node Registered
  • (Optional) If you want the microservices to communicate, you need to have the NetManager installed and properly configured.
  • You can access the APIs at <root-orch-ip>:10000/api/docs
  • You can access the Dashboard at http://<root-orch-ip>

Your first application using the Dashboard ðŸ’»

item.title: Start your Dashboard
item.description: The Dashboard is a sophisticated web-based user interface for the Oakestra system. It is designed to provide users with a comprehensive set of tools to deploy applications to a Oakestra cluster, effectively manage cluster resources, and troubleshoot any issues that may arise.

item.title: Oakestra Shines at ACM EuroSys + ASPLOS 2025
item.description: Discover how Oakestra took center stage at ACM EuroSys + ASPLOS 2025 in Rotterdam, Netherlands, with multiple awards and groundbreaking insights into edge computing orchestration.

item.title: Oakestra releases v0.4.4 (Bass)
item.description: We are proud to announce that Oakestra v0.4.4 (codename: Bass ðŸŽ¸) is here! This is the second major release for Oakestra and it packs several goodies!

item.title: Oakestra releases v0.4.301 (Accordion)
item.description: We are proud to announce that Oakestra v0.4.301 (codename: Accordion ðŸª—) is here! This is also the first major release for Oakestra and marks the beginning of a periodic release cycle.
